summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with multiple federal crimes related to the sexual exploitation and abuse of minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein, detailing her role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of victims as young as 14 between 1994 and 2004. This is a superseding indictment (Document 187) filed in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing charges of conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, sex trafficking of a minor, and perjury. It outlines specific overt acts involving Minor Victim-4 and cites false statements Maxwell made during a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and sex trafficking for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls. The indictment details her personal and professional relationship with Epstein and her direct involvement in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary perpetrator who sexually abused minor girls. The indictment details his sexual preference for underage girls and his abuse of victims facilitated by Maxwell at multiple properties.

persons.name: Minor Victim-4
persons.context: A minor recruited by Epstein and Maxwell between 2001-2004 to engage in sex acts with Epstein, and who was also encouraged to recruit other girls.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney who signed and filed the superseding indictment.

connections.description: Had a personal and professional relationship; were intimate partners from approximately 1994-1997; Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his properties and conspired with him to recruit, groom, and abuse minor victims.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties between approximately 1994 and 2004.
Maxwell recruited, enticed, and provided Minor Victim-4 to Epstein for sex acts, knowing her age, and sent her gifts.
Epstein engaged in commercial sex acts with Minor Victim-4 and provided her cash, knowing she was a minor.

events.title: Conspiracy to Abuse Minors
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, with victims as young as 14, across various locations including New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1
events.description: Maxwell groomed and participated in the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1, who was approximately 14 when they met. Abuse occurred in New York and Florida, including group sexual encounters.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell interacted with Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico ranch, taking her to a movie and shopping, and provided her with an unsolicited topless massage as part of grooming.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage him, knowing it would lead to sexual abuse.

events.title: Sex Trafficking of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Maxwell met and groomed Minor Victim-4 (approx. 14 years old) at Epstein's Palm Beach residence, facilitated paid sexual encounters, and encouraged the victim to recruit other underage girls.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell repeatedly provided false and perjurious statements under oath during a civil deposition regarding her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minors.

events.title: Recruitment and Abuse of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell recruited Minor Victim-4 to engage in sex acts with Epstein at his Palm Beach residence, paid her hundreds of dollars per encounter, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.

events.title: Gift Sent to Minor Victim-4
events.description: Epstein caused a package (including lingerie) to be sent via Federal Express from Manhattan to Minor Victim-4's residence in Florida.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition (First)
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave sworn deposition testimony in a civil case (15 Civ. 7433), falsely denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and interaction with minors.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition (Second)
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave further sworn deposition testimony, falsely denying awareness of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house and knowledge of Epstein's sexual activities with others, and denying ever giving massages.

events.title: Filing of Superseding Indictment
events.description: The United States Attorney filed a superseding indictment (S2 20 Cr. 330) against Ghislaine Maxwell with additional charges.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the case)
Palm Beach Residence (Epstein's property in Florida)
Manhattan (address from which package was sent)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and sex trafficking related to Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minors from 1994 to 2004.
Maxwell had an intimate relationship with Epstein (approx. 1994-1997) and was paid by him to manage his properties, positioning her as a key facilitator.
The indictment details the grooming process: befriending victims, normalizing sexual conduct, being present during abuse, and paying victims hundreds of dollars in cash.
Abuse occurred at multiple Epstein-owned properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's London residence.
Maxwell is accused of lying under oath during a 2016 civil deposition in an effort to conceal her crimes.
Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiracy, sex trafficking of a minor (specifically Minor Victim-4 who was under 16), and two counts of perjury for false 2016 deposition testimony.
The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein jointly recruited Minor Victim-4 between 2001-2004, paid her for sex acts, and encouraged her to recruit other underage girls.
Epstein's employees, including Maxwell, sent gifts like lingerie from New York to Minor Victim-4 in Florida, demonstrating interstate activity.
Maxwell's perjury charges stem from her denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, interaction with minors, awareness of sex toys, and ever giving massages.
The indictment includes a forfeiture allegation seeking any property used to facilitate or derived from the sex trafficking offense.
